analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the dependent origination, the section on the triplets in the Paṭṭhāna,

analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭhattika  na saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: .. The triad of the defiled🔽With a defiled phenomenon as condition, a defiled phenomenon arises,

original: hetupaccayā. Nasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko
analyzed: hetu paccayā na saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā na saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ
translated: arising from a root cause. With a defiled phenomenon as condition, an undefiled phenomenon arises,🔽arising from a root cause. With a defiled phenomenon as condition, a defiled phenomenon and an undefiled phenomenon arise,

original: ca asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.
analyzed: ca asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  na asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca
translated: arising from a root cause. With a defiled phenomenon as condition, three triads.🔽With an undefiled phenomenon as condition, an undefiled phenomenon arises, arising from a root cause. With an undefiled phenomenon as condition, five triads.

original: Naasaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: With an undefiled phenomenon as condition, a defiled phenomenon arises,🔽arising from a root cause. With an undefiled phenomenon as condition, an undefiled phenomenon arises,

analyzed: hetu paccayā na asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naasaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko🔽ca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ  ca asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A defiled and a non-defiled element arise in dependence on a non-defiled and non-corrupted element as condition. Three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke ekādasa …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke ekādasa pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: In the causal relation, there are eighteen; in the object relation, nine; in the decisive support relation, twelve; in the absence relation, three; in the non-disappearance relation, eighteen.
